item.title: What can be gleaned about GFS successor codenamed Colossus?
item.author: Pierre Zemb
item.description: In the last few months, there has been numerous blogposts about the end of the Hadoop-era. It is true that: Health of Hadoop-based companies are publicly bad Hadoop has a bad publicity with headlines like ‘What does the death of Hadoop mean for big data?’ Hadoop, as a distributed-system, is hard to operate, but can be essential for some type of workload. As Hadoop is based on GFS, we can wonder how GFS evolved inside Google.
